info.description:
Sitecore Search exposes a RESTful API called the Ingestion API that you can use to create, update,
or delete index documents. Use this API to make fast updates to your indexed content.

To view the base URL of this API, log in to the Customer Engagement Console (CEC) and go to Developer Resources > API Access.

Important: If you use the Ingestion API to update the index of a [pull source](https://doc.sitecore.com/search/en/users/search-user-guide/indexing-content.html),
when the source is [recrawled](https://doc.sitecore.com/search/en/users/search-user-guide/keeping-indexes-up-to-date.html)​​,
Search updates all index documents with the latest data from your original content.
This means that any updates you made to index documents using the Ingestion API will be overwritten
if not also made in the original content. To prevent this, we strongly recommend updating your original content
with changes made through the Ingestion API. This synchronization ensures that your modifications are maintained in future crawls.

Before you can use the Ingestion API, you must create a source in the Customer Engagement Console (CEC) and turn on
ENABLE INCREMENTAL UPDATES for that source.

For more information on how to use this API and for sample requests,
see the [Sitecore Search developer documentation](https://doc.sitecore.com/search/en/developers/search-developer-guide/using-the-ingestion-api.html).
info.title: Ingestion API

parameters.description: Numeric domain identifier. You can view this ID in the domain name drop-down in the CEC.
parameters.name: domain

parameters.description:
ID of the source for which you want to create an index document.
You can view this ID in the Administration, Sources, Source Information section of the CEC.
parameters.name: source

parameters.description: Entity the index document belongs to.
parameters.name: entity

parameters.description:
Locale to which this index document will belong. Use the LOCALE IDENTIFIER FORMAT format defined
in the Administration, General Settings, Locale section of the CEC.
parameters.name: locale

put.description: Update all fields of an index document.

parameters.description: Numeric domain identifier. You can view this ID in the domain name drop-down in the CEC.
parameters.name: domain

parameters.description:
ID of the source for which you want to update an index document.
You can view this ID in the Administration, Sources, Source Information section of the CEC.
parameters.name: source

parameters.description: Entity the index document belongs to.
parameters.name: entity

parameters.description: Unique index document ID. You can view this ID in the Content Collection section of the CEC.
parameters.name: documentId

parameters.description:
Locale to which this index document will belong.
Use the LOCALE IDENTIFIER FORMAT format defined in the Administration, General Settings, Locale section of the CEC.
parameters.name: locale

parameters.description: Numeric domain identifier. You can view this ID in the domain name drop-down in the CEC.
parameters.name: domain

parameters.description:
ID of the source for which you want to delete an index document.
You can view this ID in the Adminsitration, Sources, Source Information section of the CEC.
parameters.name: source

parameters.description: Entity the index document belongs to.
parameters.name: entity

parameters.description: Unique index document ID. You can view this ID in the Content Collection section of the CEC.
parameters.name: documentId

parameters.description:
Locales in which you want to delete documents. You can pass one, some, or all locales.
Use the LOCALE IDENTIFIER FORMAT format defined in the Administration, General Settings, Locale section of the CEC.

• To pass more than one locale, separate locales with an `&`. For example, use` locale=en_us&locale=ja_jp`.

• To pass all locales, use `locale=all`.
parameters.name: locale

patch.description: Update some fields in an index document.

parameters.description: Numeric domain identifier. You can view this ID in the domain name drop-down in the CEC.
parameters.name: domain

parameters.description:
ID of the source for which you want to partially update an index document.
You can view this ID in the Administration, Sources, Source Information section of the CEC.
parameters.name: source

parameters.description: Entity the index document belongs to.
parameters.name: entity

parameters.description: Unique index document ID. You can view this ID in the Content Collection section of the CEC.
parameters.name: documentId

parameters.description:
Locales in which you want to make partial updates to documents. You can pass one, some, or all locales.

• To pass more than one locale, separate locales with an `&`. For example, use` locale=en_us&locale=ja_jp`.

• To pass all locales, use `locale=all`.
parameters.name: locale

post.description: Create a new index document from a file.

parameters.description:
Unique index document ID. You can view this ID in the Content Collection section of the CEC.
If you use the `UPDATE` method and pass a document ID that is different from the original document ID,
Sitecore Search creates a new document instead of updating the existing document.
parameters.name: documentId

parameters.description: Numeric domain identifier. You can view this ID in the domain name drop-down in the CEC.
parameters.name: domain

parameters.description:
ID of the source for which you want to create an index document.
You can view this ID in the Administration, Sources, Source Information section of the CEC.
parameters.name: source

parameters.description: Entity the index document belongs to.
parameters.name: entity

parameters.description:
Locale to which this index document will belong. Use the LOCALE IDENTIFIER FORMAT format defined
in the Administration, General Settings, Locale section of the CEC.
parameters.name: locale

file.description: Path to the file from which you want to create an index document. The file must be on the server from which you're making the call.

fields.description:
Fixed values for attributes. Use this parameter to override the rules
of an existing document extractor and assign a fixed value to an attribute.

To learn how to format this parameter, see the [detailed reference](https://https://doc.sitecore.com/search/en/developers/search-developer-guide/ingestion-api-document-extractor-reference.html).

extractor.description:
Rules that define how to extract attribute values.
Use XPath, JavaScript, or CSS to define these rules.

To format the `extractor` parameter, refer to the [detailed reference](https://https://doc.sitecore.com/search/en/developers/search-developer-guide/ingestion-api-document-extractor-reference.html).

extractorName.description:
Name of the existing document extractor you wish to use for extracting attribute values.
To find an existing document extractor's name, in the CEC, navigate  to Sources > select a source > Document Extractors. Paste the extractor's name exactly as it appears in the CEC, including spaces and punctuation.

get.description: Get the status of an update made through the Ingestion API.
get.summary: Get status of an incremental update

url.description: URL of the original item from which you want to create an index document.

fields.description:
Fixed values for attributes. Use this parameter to override the rules
of an existing document extractor and assign a fixed value to an attribute.

To learn how to format this parameter, see the [detailed reference](https://https://doc.sitecore.com/search/en/developers/search-developer-guide/ingestion-api-document-extractor-reference.html).

extractor.description:
Logic that define how to extract attribute values.
Use XPath, JavaScript, or CSS to define these rules.

to format the `extractor` parameter, refer to the [detailed reference](https://https://doc.sitecore.com/search/en/developers/search-developer-guide/ingestion-api-document-extractor-reference.html).

extractorName.description:
Name of the existing document extractor you wish to use for extracting attribute values.
To find an existing document extractor's name, in the CEC, navigate  to Sources > select a source > Document Extractors.
Paste the extractor's name exactly as it appears in the CEC, including spaces and punctuation.

CoreErrorResponseContainer.description: an error response used when something failed during the execution of the endpoint implementation

incremental_update_id.description:
Unique Sitecore-created identifier for this request to the Ingestion API.
We recommend that you save this ID, because you'll need it to identify the original request
if you want to check later.

enqueued.description:
If `true`, your request was successful and Sitecore Search has enqueued the request. You will see the update soon.
required: true

incremental_update_ids.description: Unique Sitecore-created identifier for this request to the Ingestion API. We recommend that you save this ID, as as you'll need it to identify the original request if you later want to check the status of your update.

fields.description:
The fields that this document will contain in a `key-value` format
where the `key` is the field name and the `value` is the value of the field for this document.
You must pass all fields marked as REQUIRED in the Administration, Domain Settings, Attributes section of the CEC.
If you do not pass a required field, you get an error and Search will be unable to create or update
the index document.

example.description: Hype around the new search technology
example.title: Flashing News - Sitecore acquires RFK

id.description:
Unique index document ID. You can view this ID in the Content Collection section of the CEC.
If you use the `UPDATE` method and pass a document ID that is different from the original document ID,
Sitecore Search creates a new document instead of updating the existing document.

rules.description: the list of css/xpath/jsonpath rules to extract content

source.description: the JS source code for extracting documents

gitcommit.description: the git commit hash of the running code

status.description: the color-coded status of the service

Status of your request. The possible values are:

•`finished` - the request was successful. The index document has been created, updated, or deleted.

• `running` - the request is still in progress. Check again later.

• `failed` - the request has failed and the index document was not created, updated, or deleted. Retry the request.
Possible Values are - failed, running and finished
in: body

enqueued.description:
If `true`, your request was successful and Sitecore Search has enqueued the request. You will see the update soon.
in: body

incremental_update_ids.description: Unique Sitecore-created identifier for this request to the Ingestion API. We recommend that you save this ID, as as you'll need it to identify the original request if you later want to check the status of your update.

attribute.description: tag attribute name to extract text content (only for css)

default.description: the default value to use if the value extracted is empty

expression.description: css selector/xpath expression/jsonpath expression to extract text content

enqueued.description:
If `true`, your request was successful and Sitecore Search has enqueued the request. You will see the update soon.
in: body
